title: 20-Years-Owned Supercharged 2001 Acura NSX-T 6-Speed
description: This 2001 Acura NSX-T was purchased by the seller in 2005 and has been modified with a Science of Speed supercharger, slotted brake rotors, KW V3 coilovers, Rays Volk Racing 17" and 18" multi-piece wheels, an aftermarket exhaust system and radiator, an iPod connector, and a glovebox-mounted AEM auxiliary gauge. Powered by a 3.2-liter DOHC V6 paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, it is finished in Silverstone Metallic over Onyx leather upholstery. The car shows 99k miles and is further equipped with a limited-slip differential, a removable body-color roof panel, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Bose sound system. This NSX-T is now offered with a window sticker, the owner's manual, service records, spare parts, a car cover, a Carfax report, and a clean New Mexico title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 20-Years-Owned Supercharged 2001 Acura NSX-T 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #195,120.
text: This 2001 Acura NSX-T was purchased by the seller in 2005 and has been modified with a Science of Speed supercharger, slotted brake rotors, KW V3 coilovers, Rays Volk Racing 17″ and 18″ multi-piece wheels, an aftermarket exhaust system and radiator, an iPod connector, and a glovebox-mounted AEM auxiliary gauge. Powered by a 3.2-liter DOHC V6 paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, it is finished in Silverstone Metallic over Onyx leather upholstery. The car shows 99k miles and is further equipped with a limited-slip differential, a removable body-color roof panel, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Bose sound system. This NSX-T is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, a car cover, a Carfax report, and a clean New Mexico title in the seller’s name. The NSX featured aluminum bodywork, and this example is finished in Silverstone Metallic with a body-color removable roof panel. Exterior details include pop-up headlights, an integrated rear wing, side air intakes, power-adjustable side mirrors, and quad exhaust outlets. According to the seller, the front lower bumper cover and right-front fender have been refinished, and a September 2006 entry states that the vehicle was “inspected after an accident or other incident.” A crease is located on the driver’s door, the windshield has chips, and blemishes are noted on the paint protection film, which covers the front end. The Rays Volk Racing 17″ and 18″ multi-piece wheels are mounted with Yokohama tires. Braking is handled by NSX-branded calipers over slotted and ventilated rotors at each corner, and the car is equipped with KW V3 coilovers. A brake fluid flush was performed in July 2024. The power-adjustable sport seats are upholstered in Onyx leather, while NSX-branded floor mats line the footwells. The car has been hardwired for a radar detector, and additional interior appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, a Bose sound system, iPod connectivity, and a cassette stereo linked to a six-disc CD changer. The stainless-steel door sill plates are stamped with the car’s serial number. The air conditioning refrigerant was recharged in July 2024, and work in April 2025 included repairing the cruise control system, reverse lockout switch, and climate control unit. The driver’s seat has tears, the tire inflator does not work, the left turn signal does not self-cancel, and the driver’s seat is worn. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline, a 188-mph speedometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. An AEM gauge is located inside of the glovebox. The six-digit odometer shows 99k miles, approximately 90k of which were added under current ownership. The 3.2-liter C32B V6 has been fitted with a Science of Speed supercharger and features dual overhead camshafts on each cylinder bank, an aftermarket radiator, and VTEC variable valve timing. A timing belt service was carried out in May 2023, an oil change was performed in July 2024, and the supercharger oil was replaced in April 2025. The seller states the idle speed wanders intermittently. Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. An aftermarket exhaust system has been installed, and work in July 2024 included replacing the transaxle fluid and fitted a replacement clutch and flywheel. The window sticker shows initial delivery to Courtesy Acura of Littleton, Colorado, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total vehicle price of $88,745. The Carfax report shows the aforementioned vehicle inspection entry. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. Your real-time updates could not be connected. html:
This 2001 Acura NSX-T was purchased by the seller in 2005 and has been modified with a Science of Speed supercharger, slotted brake rotors, KW V3 coilovers, Rays Volk Racing 17″ and 18″ multi-piece wheels, an aftermarket exhaust system and radiator, an iPod connector, and a glovebox-mounted AEM auxiliary gauge. Powered by a 3.2-liter DOHC V6 paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, it is finished in Silverstone Metallic over Onyx leather upholstery. The car shows 99k miles and is further equipped with a limited-slip differential, a removable body-color roof panel, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Bose sound system. This NSX-T is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, a car cover, a Carfax report, and a clean New Mexico title in the seller’s name.

The NSX featured aluminum bodywork, and this example is finished in Silverstone Metallic with a body-color removable roof panel. Exterior details include pop-up headlights, an integrated rear wing, side air intakes, power-adjustable side mirrors, and quad exhaust outlets. According to the seller, the front lower bumper cover and right-front fender have been refinished, and a September 2006 entry states that the vehicle was “inspected after an accident or other incident.” A crease is located on the driver’s door, the windshield has chips, and blemishes are noted on the paint protection film, which covers the front end.

The Rays Volk Racing 17″ and 18″ multi-piece wheels are mounted with Yokohama tires. Braking is handled by NSX-branded calipers over slotted and ventilated rotors at each corner, and the car is equipped with KW V3 coilovers. A brake fluid flush was performed in July 2024.

The power-adjustable sport seats are upholstered in Onyx leather, while NSX-branded floor mats line the footwells. The car has been hardwired for a radar detector, and additional interior appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, a Bose sound system, iPod connectivity, and a cassette stereo linked to a six-disc CD changer. The stainless-steel door sill plates are stamped with the car’s serial number. The air conditioning refrigerant was recharged in July 2024, and work in April 2025 included repairing the cruise control system, reverse lockout switch, and climate control unit. The driver’s seat has tears, the tire inflator does not work, the left turn signal does not self-cancel, and the driver’s seat is worn.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline, a 188-mph speedometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. An AEM gauge is located inside of the glovebox. The six-digit odometer shows 99k miles, approximately 90k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter C32B V6 has been fitted with a Science of Speed supercharger and features dual overhead camshafts on each cylinder bank, an aftermarket radiator, and VTEC variable valve timing. A timing belt service was carried out in May 2023, an oil change was performed in July 2024, and the supercharger oil was replaced in April 2025. The seller states the idle speed wanders intermittently.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. An aftermarket exhaust system has been installed, and work in July 2024 included replacing the transaxle fluid and fitted a replacement clutch and flywheel.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Courtesy Acura of Littleton, Colorado, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total vehicle price of $88,745.

The Carfax report shows the aforementioned vehicle inspection entry.
